document.docAuthor: Dias, Everton S. & Calor, Adolfo R.
document.docTitle: Centromacronema pioneira Dias & Calor, 2016, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Centromacronema Ulmer 1905 (Hydropsychidae: Macronematinae) from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Centromacronema Ulmer 1905 (Hydropsychidae: Macronematinae) from Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This new species differs from its congeners by the following characters: forewing color pattern dark brown with a long and narrow longitudinal band of yellow setae between veins C and R 1 ; another longitudinal band between Cu 1 and Cu 2 , and a triangular band with dark yellow setae between veins R 1 and R 3 extending to the discoidal cell; the inferior appendages are each slightly enlarged in their basal 1 / 3 followed by a constriction in lateral view; segment X mesally enlarged in dorsal view.
Centromacronema pioneira
n . sp .
is similar to
C. nigripenne
Flint 1981
, except by the morphology of the inferior appendages (not enlarged at basal 1 / 3 in
C. nigripenne
), length of segment X (shorter in
C. nigripenne
) and shape of setal warts at segment X (reduced, not digitate in
C. nigripenne
).

Male. Length of each forewing 10.7–11.5 mm (n= 6 ); length of each hind wing 7.8 –8.0 mm (n= 6 ). Head . Black dorsally with black setae; maxillary palps brown with dark brown setae (in alcohol). Thorax . Pronotum black dorsally, pronotal setal warts with black setae; mesoscutum and metanotum black with yellow clothing hairs. Legs pale yellow; foretibiae each with apical process (
Fig. 1
C); tibial spur formula 0,4, 4 . Forewings brown, each with long and narrow longitudinal band of yellow setae between veins C and R 1 , longitudinal band between Cu 1 and Cu 2 , triangular band with dark yellow setae between veins R 1 and R 3 extending to discoidal cell; veins Sc, R 1 , M 2 , Cu 1 a, Cu 1 b, Cu 2 and A 2 thickened; discoidal cell small, nearly rounded; crossveins sc -r
1
, r -m , m-cu , and
cu 1 b -cu 2
,
cu 2 -A
present; forks I–V present (
Fig. 1
A). Hind wings brown; veins Sc, R 1 , R 2 , and R 3 fused before margin; veins R 1 , Cu 1 a, Cu 1 b and A 4 thickened; crossveins r -m , m -cu , and
cu 2 -A
present; forks II, III, and V present (
Fig. 1
B). Abdomen . Segment IX setose, distal margin rounded with slight median invagination in dorsal view (
Fig. 1
F); in lateral view, longer medially than dorsally or ventrally, dorsal apex triangular, narrow posteriorly; distal margin setose dorsally and laterally (
Fig. 1
D). Segment X bifid, each lobe enlarged mesally at midlength, apex rounded in dorsal view (
Fig. 1
F); in lateral view, tall basally, acuminate apically and curved dorsad, setal warts well developed in middle (
Fig. 1
D). Inferior appendages long, setose, especially basally, slightly larger in basal third, anterior margin of basal region with median invagination, apex rounded in lateral view (
Fig. 1
D); in ventral view, setose, enlarged basally, curved mesad apically, apex rounded (
Fig. 1
E). Phallus relatively short, well developed basally, constricted at midlength, apex truncate; wall of endotheca subquadrate in lateral view (
Fig. 1
G); in ventral view, phallus laterally constricted at midlength, wall of endotheca subquadrate (
Fig. 1
H).

Female. Length of each forewing 10.6–12.3 mm (n= 4 ); length of each hind wing 7.7–9.1 mm (n= 4 ). Head . Dark brown. Thorax . Pronotal setal warts white, rounded, in middle. Legs pale yellow; foretibiae each with apical process; tibial spur formula 0,4, 4 . Forewings brown; crossveins r
1
-r
2
,, m -cu and cu
2
-a present; veins R 2 , R 3 , M 2 , Cu 1 a and A 2 thickened (
Fig. 2
A). Hindwings brown; crossvein r -m present; veins Sc, R 1 , R 2 and R 3 fused for short distance distally before margin; forks II, III, and V present (
Fig. 2
B). Abdomen . Segment VIII ventral plate (Vt pl) setose, rounded ventrally in lateral view (
Fig. 2
D), separated by membrane (v. VIII) mesoventrally (
Fig. 2
E). Segment IX longer than in male, on each side posterior ventrolateral apex (gon. IXa) rounded, anteroventral region constricted, ventral margin truncate, apicodorsal margin and vertical posterolateral ridge setose in lateral view (
Fig. 2
D); in ventral view, broad in anterior region (
Fig. 2
E). Segment Xa large, distal margin setose, rounded, with two pairs of digitate papillae separated by pair of conical cerci at dorsal apex in lateral view (
Fig. 2
D); in ventral view, subquadrate, papillae digitate, cerci conical, setose (
Fig. 2
E). Gonopods IXa broad basally, rounded apically on each side in lateral view (
Fig. 2
D); in ventral view, apically rounded (
Fig. 2
E). Processus spermathecae with anterior apex truncate in ventral view, slightly invaginated on each side below apex beyond pair of small rounded lateral processes (
Fig. 2
C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Centromacronema pioneira
n . sp .
male: 1A, right forewing, dorsal; 1B, right hind wing, dorsal; 1C, right foretibia; 1D, genitalia, left lateral; 1E, left inferior appendage, caudoventral; 1F, genitalia, dorsal; 1G, phallus, left lateral; 1H, phallus, ventral. Abbreviations: Ap. pr = apical process of foretibiae; Inf ap = inferior appendage; Seg IX = abdominal segment IX; Seg X = abdominal segment X; Phb = phallobase; Wall end = wall of endotheca; Wing venation: A = anal veins 1–4; Cu = cubital veins 1–2; M = medial veins 1–4; R = radial veins 1–5; Sc = subcostal vein; I–V = apical forks I–V.

FIGURE 2 .
Centromacronema pioneira
n . sp .
, female. 2A, right forewing, dorsal; 2B, right hind wing, dorsal; 2C, vaginal apparatus, ventral; 2D, genitalia, left lateral; 2E, genitalia, ventral. Abbreviations: Cer = cercus; e. gon. VIII = external parts of gonopods VIII; gon. IXa = gonopod of abdominal segment IX; i. gon. VIII = internal parts of gonopods VIII; IX = abdominal segment IX; Pa = papillae; VIII = abdominal segment VIII; v. VIII = venter abdominal segment VIII; Vt pl = ventral plate of abdominal segment VIII; Xa = abdominal segment X; Wing venation: A = anal veins 1–4; Cu = cubital veins 1–2; M = medial veins 1–4; R = radial veins 1–5; Sc = subcostal vein; I–V = apical forks I–V.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype male
(alcohol, MZSP ).
BRAZIL : Bahia
, Santa Teresinha, Pedra Branca, Serra da Jiboia, Morro da Pioneira , Córrego das Torres,
12 º 51 ’01.6’’S
,
39 ° 28 ’ 48 ’’W
, el. 679 m ,
07.viii. 2014
, UV Light Pan trap, E.S. Dias, L.L. Queiroz & D. Capelli.

(alcohol, UFBA ).

Etymology. The species epithet is a noun in apposition to the genus name, with unvarying gender, referring to Morro da Pioneira , a mountain in the Serra da Jibóia massif, where the type series was collected.
